title: CTRL0000061471 - Transcribed Interview of Scott Johnston, (April 5, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The interview in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 4:01 p.m.
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
So the time is 4:01 p.m., and this is the transcribed interview of Scott
Johnston conducted by the Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the
503, and it's being conducted remotely via the Webex platform.
My name i s - and I'm an investigative counsel with the select
With me from the select committee staff are
We're also joined by a couple of professional staff members:
This interview is being conducted pursuant to House Resolution
Although this is a staff-led deposition, members of the select committee may join
if they choose, and if they do, they can ask questions.
I don't know if any will join us
today, but if they do, I'll pause and just acknowledge for the record that they've joined.
Mr. Johnston, I just want to make clear for the record that you're participating in
this interview voluntarily, which we appreciate.
acknowledge for the record that you were advised of the option to have a lawyer present
with you and ultimately have declined to have counsel with you here today.
And I also want to make sure that we
Just a few ground rules, logistics for the conversation we're
going to have, just in terms of the transcription of it.
The video feed, as you heard at the
very beginning, is being recorded through the Webex platform, but the reporter's
transcription writing down what we say is going to be the official record of the
We just ask to confirm that you are not recording the interview on your end.
And also confirm that no one else is present with you.
No one else is present with me.
Please wait until each question is completed before
you begin to respond, and we will do our best to wait until your response is complete
before we ask the next question.
shaking or nodding your head, so it's important that you respond to each question with
The reporter can't note nonverbal responses, such as
We'd ask that you give answers to the best of your recollection, and if a question
is unclear, please ask for clarification.
If you don't know the answer, it's fine just to say
And, finally, I remind you, as we remind all witnesses, that it is unlawful to
deliberately provide false information to Congress and doing so could result in criminal
So I don't think we're going to take a long time today,
but if at any point you want to take a break, stretch your legs, get a drink of water, we can
questions, we can plunge right in.
Just say so and we can pause.
But otherwise, unless you have any
Do you need me to mute myself each
time when I'm not talking, or is there not much background noise there if I leave it off
I can hear you just fine.
I don't think there's any technical issues,
and if there's something that's going on, somebody can pop up and let us know, but I
think for now we're good the way it is.
So, Mr. Johnston, could you please state your full legal name?
And in what city and State do you currently live?
My legal residence is in Sioux Falls, South Dakota.
And is that where you currently are now?
And so help me understand that.
say legal residence in Sioux Falls.
You seemed to make a point to
Are you in Mexico on vacation, long term?
Dakota recognizes full-time nomad status in order to give you residency in a State.
So a resident of South Dakota, but indefinitely in Mexico.
Not indefinitely, but for the next few months, yeah.
And I'm not going to put your full phone number on the record, but I just
Where did you consider yourself to live between November 2020 and
want to confirm that you have a cell phone with
And is that the phone number you were using between November 2020 and
Were there any other phone numbers that you were using during that time
And during that interview, we discussed how you came to participate in the
Now, you and I previously spoke in December of 2021.
Women for America First bus tour in late 2020.
So I just want to confirm that I have some of the basic details of that correct.
If I remember correctly, your first interactions with Women for America First came when
you were invited by Dustin Stockton and Jennifer Lawrence to attend a November 14,
That is correct, at the Supreme Court.
Now, can you tell us briefly what the basis of your acquaintance with
Mr. Stockton and Ms. Lawrence is?
I have known them and stayed in contact through them throughout the
years when they worked with the campaign in the State of Arizona for Kelli Ward when
she was running for U.S. Senate.
And we became friends at that point in time.
Do you remember about what year that was?
Now, before November of 2020, had you ever met or interacted with Amy
I didn't even know who they were.
So safe to say the first time you met or interacted with them was at this
Now, following that, I understand from our previous conversation that you
were asked by the Kremers to join them on their March for Trump bus tour.
So explain to us what that request was and how you came to be on
the bus tour following the D.C. event at the Supreme Court?
Just a simple, hey, they're organizing a bus tour that we were talking about,
that they were talking about after the Supreme Court rally:
Would you like to join us?
We know you've got some free time right now from work or your schedule is more open;
And so what did you understand you were going to be doing on the tour?
My understanding of why I was officially brought on was Dustin needed help
Would you like to come with us?
just doing simple administrative tasks or, you know, having some sort of assistant to kind
of help him with whatever -- whatever he needed done, you know, running simple
errands for him or other tasks.
And were you expecting to be paid for your role?
Did you expect to be reimbursed for expenses that you incurred?
I was reimbursed for expenses that were incurred.
Now, following the bus tour, did you ask for payment for the services that
I was told -- to clarify the payment question, I was told in the middle of the
tour, after the rallies in December, that they would pay me a thousand dollars a week to
continue on the tour with them, and they would go back to the beginning.
That's great, go ahead, you know.
And they never -- they never made that payment.
week to stay on the tour, who told you that?
Dustin told me, and then Kylie had also mentioned -- Kylie Kremer had

My understanding is there was some sort of disagreement with Dustin and
Amy, with the Kremers in general, I guess you could say.
withholding payment to me, trying to use that as leverage.
So it was -- I was totally
And when you say you were told that you'd be paid a thousand dollars a
Now, did you know whether Dustin and Jennifer were expecting to be

I don't know what their agreement was, no.
But what was the basis then of the dispute between Dustin and the Kremers
that your, for lack of a better way of putting it, compensation kind of became the sacrifice
I don't recall the exact -- the exact issue.
But just to put a pin on it, you thought you were going to be paid a

around either in a pickup that they had that was towing a U-Haul a lot of the time at the
say is when I was transferred into a Suburban with another gentleman by the name of

And then towards middle to end of -- middle of the tour I would

Black Friday, yep, is when I flew out to Miami.
So were you continuously with the group from Black Friday through January

I was continually with somebody from the group, yes.
period when they had driven back or they were going back from D.C. to Las Vegas, or the

I'm going to say that it was right around December 18th, 19th.
It would have been -- it was right before Christmas.
So were you with the March for Trump bus tour on

1111, are you able to pull up exhibit 1?
December 16th is when I flew out.
So you can see this is marked as exhibit 1.
So this is an email that was produced by Kylie Jane Kremer.
And so that would have been following the December 12th event in
Can you see that okay, Mr.
down, what this is, is it's forwarding an itinerary as of about December 27th for this

see, according to this document, December 27th, there's a bus call in the afternoon to
leave Las Vegas to drive to Pasadena, California.
can see here that they're saying they're going to have.
then stay at a Westin in Pasadena the night of the 27th.
And, along the way, there's events you
Depart that event about an hour and a half later, and
Then you can see, the next day, the 28th, according to this schedule, leave

And if we scroll down a little bit further here, on the night of the 28th, arriving in

And the next day, December 29th, leaving that morning from Palm Desert to drive

border wall on Sunland Park on December 30, 2020.
Mr. Johnston, to the best of your knowledge, is that itinerary accurate for the
stops that the bus tour went to during this time period?
Can you scroll back up to the 28th on there for me?
So they deviated a little bit from that.
So not too far from Las Cruces.
That appears to be the proper address of the
I'd have to double-check it, but it does look accurate.
So I guess then, from a bigger picture perspective, were you with the bus
tour as it went from Las Vegas to El Paso?
The majority of the time, yes.
We were on the same route.
You were playing the role as a driver for the tour during this time period?
Now, and the reason I wanted to draw that out is because,
obviously, you know one of the reasons that we spoke -- we've been interested in
speaking with you is because of this discussion of prepaid telephones on this bus tour,
you know, sometimes called burner phones.
And I'm happy to use whatever
But we just want to go through the details of as much as you can tell us about this
specific sort of moment in time, because I understand that you had a pretty specific

the reasons I wanted to put this itinerary in front of you was, if it's generally accurate,
trying to place exactly when during this stretch of the tour this burner phone transaction
and any conversations on these phones may have happened.
So, if you could, why don't you start by just telling us in as much detail as you
remember, and then I'll ask followups, as needed.
events that were in Huntington Beach and wherever else they had them that day.
So, on Monday, the 28th, is when I had Kylie Kremer in the vehicle
We did not -- I did not attend, and we didn't drive to the other
Kylie rode in the -- we first had a different rental vehicle, which we had to go swap
And we swapped that out at the -- I believe it was the Ontario Airport in California.
I'd have to double-check on their -- those records.
had to have a Suburban or a Tahoe.
Swapped out a vehicle because Amy
Kylie was there in the vehicle.
discussing, you know, how events were going to unfold and how there was going to be

So you were in Pasadena on the night of the 27th, and

Because we had to pick up another gal, Katie Kegel,
who had flown into the area.

That she needed a way of communicating with top-level officials.

forth handling something with the front desk of the hotel.

local SIM card with local service on there for the time that you're there.

how burner phones would work in the United States, how you would purchase them, and

in a call center and such like that, I said:

the reason she was getting them was to stay -- fly under the radar.

from the Palm Springs area to New Mexico and Texas the next day?

sources who were on the bus tour, including someone who said that Kylie Kremer
